Description: Turquoise pendant in the form of a seated cat, bound in gold ring for suspension; intertwined gold wire is bound about the body of the animal, extending to a thicker wire for the suspension loop; one ear of cat is broken.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Turner Bequest Excavations, Curium
Curator's comments: According to Bailey & Hockey, the cat figure may be an import from Egypt (p. 112); the gold binding is not assignable to any particular place but is probably local.
Bibliographic references: Jewellery / Catalogue of the Jewellery, Greek, Etruscan, and Roman, in the Departments of Antiquities, British Museum. (2050)
Murray, Smith and Walters 1900 / Excavations in Cyprus (p. 82, Tomb 73 no. 9; pl. XIII, 20)
